Episodes.Title: Pilot
Episodes.Plot: It's a typical day in the life for Mark: he attempts to deal with his zombie roommate, his demonic girlfriend who wants him to meet Daddy, and Homeland Security's efforts to use Mark's client list to meet their quote of illegal immigrant roundups so they can win a ham.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: An American Werewolf in America
Episodes.Plot: Mark tries to deal with a werewolf integration case, but has more on his hands when Randall can't resist his zombie urges, and Leonard decides to top his brother Christ Angel by performing the ultimate illusion: resurrecting Mark from the dead.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Demon Baby
Episodes.Plot: When Mark takes care of an abandoned demon baby, Callie finds herself suffering from strange maternal demon impulses, and Twayne smells her pheromones and grows a mating bone.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Blob Gets a Job
Episodes.Plot: Mark accidentally outs his roommate as a zombie; Leonard tries to identify a strange new creature.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Treegasm
Episodes.Plot: Mark meets a pair of creatures who are expected to participate in a public mating ritual.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: So, You Want to Be a Vampire?
Episodes.Plot: As the city contends with a bizarre epidemic, Mark counsels a young woman who wants to become a vampire.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Kong of Queens
Episodes.Plot: When the budget for social services is cut, Mark and Leonard find themselves with time off. Mark tries to help Randall, who has been severed at the waist and needs new legs, while counseling a giant ape with OCD. Meanwhile, Callie and Twayne attend a demon convention, and Callie worries that Twayne is hitting on her.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Better Off Undead
Episodes.Plot: Mark counsels Tim the two-headed worm creature and gives psychiatric evaluations to Department of Integration employees while Randall seeks to become a proper zombie.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Kill...Mark, Kill
Episodes.Plot: Mark tries to help Leonard with his wand issues, Twayne meets his soul mate.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Sympathy for the Devil
Episodes.Plot: Twayne is forced to endure a series of difficult consequences when he decides to make a horrendous agreement regarding a local politician's soul.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,sexual references and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Hell for the Holidays
Episodes.Plot: Mark and Randall go down to hell to spend Halloween with Callie's family who have some special plan for Mark.

Episodes.Title: Trolling for Terror
Episodes.Plot: After Randall joins the cast of a sleazy reality show, the program?s unbalanced producer becomes obsessed with Mark.

Episodes.Title: Soulsucker
Episodes.Plot: Because of Mark's Zechalech gift, Callie is under the impression that he wants her to suck out his soul.

Episodes.Title: The Manbirds
Episodes.Plot: Mark adopts a baby Man-Bird that was separated from its flock, while Grimes tries to settle a blood-feud with their champion.
